message.content:
<<<api>>>: Scanner.hasNext()
<<<code>>>: public static ArrayList dataRead() throws FileNotFoundException {
    Scanner s = new Scanner(new File("c:\\stats.txt")).useDelimiter("\r");
    ArrayList<String> array = new ArrayList<String>();
    int i = 0;
    while(s.hasNext()) {
        String currentLine = s.next();
        Scanner split = new Scanner(currentLine).useDelimiter("\t");
        for(int j = 0; j < 16; j++) {
            System.out.print(split.next() + " ");
            j++;
        }
        System.out.println("\r");
    }
    s.close();
    return array;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are calling `s.next()` twice in the while loop condition and inside the loop. This causes the scanner to advance twice in each iteration, leading to the `NoSuchElementException` when there are no more tokens.

To properly end the while loop and close the scanner, you can use the `Scanner.hasNext()` method in the while loop condition. This method returns `true` if there is another token available, and `false` otherwise. By using `s.hasNext()` instead of `s.next() != null`, you can correctly handle the end of the file and avoid the `NoSuchElementException`.
